availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel W. Suddarth (Assistant surgeon, Capital Guard Regiment)

body.p: Columbia, Kentucky, druggist and physician. Adair County, Kentucky, native. Son of Daniel Suddarth and Nancy Suddarth. Farmer in Adair County in 1850. Druggist in Columbia in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and sergeant from 1861 to 1863. Commissioned assistant surgeon in the Capital Guard Regiment, Kentucky State Troops.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 30B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Columbia, p. 1.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 176.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 958.
